Adding Files to a Project

To add files from your workstation to a project folder, they must be in the correct working folder. Verify this fact before beginning the operation.

To add files:

  1. Open the project view to which you wish to add files.

  2. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  3. Select the File tab.

  4. (Optional) Click All Descendants on the toolbar to display all the files located in the child folders of the selected parent folder.

  5. Select the <All Files By Status> or Files Not In View filter from the filter list box on the toolbar. If you select the <All Files By Status> filter, click the minus button in front of the Not In View group to display the files. The Not In View status is assigned to each file in a working folder that is not already added to the project (and, therefore, is not under version control).

  6. Do one of the following:

    • Select individual files to be added to the project.

    • Choose Select > Select All from the File or context menu to select all the files simultaneously.

  7. Select Add Files from the File or context menu. The Add Files dialog opens.

  8. Do one of the following:

    • Type a generic description for all files in the File Description text box.

    • Select the Prompt for description for each file check box to enter a separate description for each file.

  9. From the Lock status group box, select an appropriate option button. Use Exclusive or Non-exclusive to lock the files in your name or select the Unlocked option button to leave the files unlocked.

    10. Locking a file lets other team members know that you are working on it. An exclusive lock indicates that you intend to change this file; it also prevents others from checking the file in.

  10. (Optional) Select Delete working files to remove the associated files from your workstation. Clear this box to retain these files in your working folder.

  11. (Required if process rules are enforced) To link the new files to process items, select the Link and pin process item check box. See Understanding Process Rules and Linking New Files to Process Items.

  12. If work on the active process item is now complete, select the Mark selected process item as fixed/finished/complete check box.

  13. Select a label from the Revision label drop-down combo box or create a new revision label by entering its name. Adding or creating a label is useful if you plan to retrieve these files as a group later or if you will need this specific revision of the files.

  14. If you are using the Windows client, click OK to add the files.

  15. If you are using the Cross-Platform client, you have additional options that may be useful. To access these options::

    1. Click Advanced. This action displays the Advanced Options dialog. Although none of the options on this dialog are required, they are useful in specific situations.

    2. Select the Perform EOL conversion (CR-LF) check box to control the EOL character that is stored with the files. The default setting for this check box is based on the EOL setting in your Personal Options.

    3. Select the appropriate File Encoding from the drop-down list box.

    4. Click OK to return to the Add Files dialog.

    5. Click OK to add the files.

    Note: When you add new files to the application, the status for these files changes from Not In View to Current, unless you have deleted these files from your working directory, which changes their status to Missing.
